text: I never expect to see a perfect work from an imperfect man.
author: Alexander Hamilton

text: Safety from external danger is the most powerful director of national conduct.
author: Alexander Hamilton

text: Self-preservation is the first principle of our nature.
author: Alexander Hamilton

text: In framing a government which is to be administered by men over men the great difficulty lies in this: You must first enable the government to control the governed, and in the next place, oblige it to control itself.
author: Alexander Hamilton

text: A promise must never be broken.
author: Alexander Hamilton

text: He who stands for nothing will fall for anything.
author: Alexander Hamilton

text: I never expect to see a perfect work from imperfect man.
author: Alexander Hamilton

text: A well adjusted person is one who makes the same mistake twice without getting nervous.
author: Alexander Hamilton

text: Real firmness is good for anything; strut is good for nothing.
author: Alexander Hamilton

text: Common interest may always be reckoned upon as the surest bond of sympathy.
author: Alexander Hamilton

text: The Courts must declare the sense of the law; and if they should be disposed to exercise will instead of judgement; the consequences would be the substitution of their pleasure for that of the legislative body.
author: Alexander Hamilton

text: In framing a government which is to be administered by men over men, the great difficulty lies in this: you must first enable the government to control the governed; and in the next place, oblige it to control itself.
author: Alexander Hamilton

text: Take mankind in general, they are vicious-their passions may be operated upon.
author: Alexander Hamilton

text: If you don't stand for something, you will fall for anything.
author: Alexander Hamilton

text: A fondness for power is implanted in most men, and it is natural to abuse it when acquired.
author: Alexander Hamilton

text: The standard of good behavior for the continuance in office of the judicial magistracy is certainly one of the most valuable of the modern improvements in the practice of government.
author: Alexander Hamilton

text: The nation which can prefer disgrace to danger is prepared for a master and deserves one.
author: Alexander Hamilton

text: The attributes of sovereignty are now enjoyed by every state in the Union.
author: Alexander Hamilton

text: There is a certain enthusiasm in liberty, that makes human nature rise above itself in acts of bravery and heroism.
author: Alexander Hamilton

text: When the sword is once drawn, the passions of men observe no bounds of moderation.
author: Alexander Hamilton

text: Then the effort that I have made is what people are pleased to call the fruit of genius. It is the fruit of labor and thought.
author: Alexander Hamilton
